# Draft:Center for Information, Democracy & Citizenship (CIDC)

}}
The Center for Information, Democracy, and Citizenship (CIDC) is a think tank and a multidisciplinary research and civic engagement center under the jurisdiction of the [https://www.aubg.edu/ American University in Bulgaria (AUBG)]  in Blagoevgrad, Bulgaria.  Founded in 2022 at the American University of Bulgaria, the center conducts research and projects related to democracy, civic engagement, and disinformation issues.
In 2025, CIDC published the [https://disinfobs.com/index.php/2025/04/10/the-pravda-ecosystem-an-analysis-of-the-kremlins-regional-disinformation-strategy/ Pravda Report], which analyzed Russian disinformation networks in Eastern Europe, in collaboration with Sofia-based company [https://sensika.com/ Sensika] as part of the [https://www.aubg.edu/center-for-information-democracy-and-citizenship-cidc/cidc-insights/?region=bulgaria%20Strategic%20Information%20Threats Strategic Information Threats Report - SITRep] series. As [https://www.euronews.com/my-europe/2025/04/18/which-european-countries-are-most-exposed-to-russian-disinformation Euronews]  and [https://www.svobodnaevropa.bg/amp/balgaria-kampania-rusia-pravda-dezinformacia/33384703.html Svobodna Evropa]  state, the report examined an AI-driven Russian disinformation network of websites, targeting over 80 countries, with a particular focus on Soviet states, the Balkans, and Central Europe with the aim to destabilize democratic societies.
The center runs journalistic fellowships such as the Bulgaria International Journalism Fellowship
[https://www.aubg.edu/center-for-information-democracy-and-citizenship-cidc/bijf/?region=bulgaria The Bulgaria International Journalism Fellowship (BIJF)] and The [https://www.aubg.edu/christo-grozev-fellowship-for-courageous-journalism/ Christo Grozev Fellowship for Courageous Journalism].
Program Areas
CIDC's activities are organized into five programmatic areas:
* Information Integrity and Disinformation Response – this area includes projects on resilience,
* media literacy,  against foreign influence, and cognitive security. A project in this area is the [https://disinfobs.com/ CIDC-Sensika Disinformation Observatory] - a regional media monitoring platform and research based observatory targeted at understanding and combatting disinformation in Eastern Europe.
* Civic Education and Democratic Participation – the Center has developed digital platforms and community initiatives on civic knowledge and engagement.  In 2025 CIDC held the first in Bulgaria [https://www.karieri.bg/news/41504_blizo-50-mladezhi-uchastvaha-v-prvata-mladezhka-asamble Youth Citizen's Assembly in Bulgaria], which addressed the issue of youth employment.https://www.karieri.bg/news/41504_blizo-50-mladezhi-uchastvaha-v-prvata-mladezhka-asamble|title=Близо 50 делегати участваха в първата Младежка гражданска асамблея | Никол Методиева, Кариери |
* Factual Media and Journalist Support – CIDC runs fellowship programs for journalists and media outlets in Eastern Europe. The [https://www.aubg.edu/christo-grozev-fellowship-for-courageous-journalism/ Christo Grozev Fellowship for Courageous Journalism], established in 2025-2026, is run under the patronage of the investigative journalist, former lead Russia investigator of [https://www.bellingcat.com/ Bellingcat] , and critic of Putin's regime Christo Grozev.  Its fellows include Finn Perelstein and ICFJ Knight Award co-winner Philip Obaji Jr. Another initiative is The Bulgarian International Journalism Fellowship, established in 2024. It includes Bulgarian journalists Joanna Elmy and Spas Spassov as senior fellows.
* Transdisciplinary Democracy Innovation – this program connects academia, policymaking, and civil society in projects related to digital literacy and civic participation. Projects include [https://elkana.ceu.edu/ai-aware-universities AI Aware Universities] and [https://www.aubg.edu/center-for-information-democracy-and-citizenship-cidc/in-loco/?region=bulgaria IN-LOCO].
* Academic and Community Engagement – this area supports faculty and student-led initiatives that foster innovation and civic responsibility.
